availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Costin Beauchamp (Hancock County, Kentucky, planter)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, planter. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Hause Beauchamp. Married to Sarah Ann Stowers Beauchamp. Father of John W. Beauchamp, David Beauchamp, Catharine Beauchamp, Alexander Beauchamp, Joseph Beauchamp, and Julia A. Beauchamp. Planter in Hancock County in 1850 and 1860. Owned twenty-six enslaved persons in 1850 and twenty-five in 1860. Founding member of the Hancock Pond Draining Company in 1850. Founding member of the Hancock County Agricultural Society in 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 18; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 1; "An Act to Incorporate the Hancock Pond Draining Company, and amend the charter of the Jefferson Pond Draining Company," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at December Session, 1849 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges & Co.â€“ State Printers, 1849), 390-394; "An Act to Incorporate the Hancock County Agricultural Society," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Passed at the . . . Monday, the Fourth Day of December 1865 (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 522-523; Find A Grave, "Robert Costin Beauchamp (1800-1884)," Memorial #87780096, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=87780096 (accessed April 6, 2017).
